Originally a compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=おとうと|弟|t1=younger sibling|tr1=oto|人|t2=person|tr2=hito}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref>

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|おとうと|acc=4|acc_ref=NHK,DJR}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|おとうと}}

# one’s own [[younger]] [[brother]]
# a younger [[male]]

=====Usage notes=====
Used when referring to one’s own younger brother.  To refer to someone else’s younger brother, the suffixed form {{m|ja|弟}}{{m|ja|さん|tr=otōto-san}} is used instead.  When ''addressing'' one’s own younger brother, the given name is used, often with a suffix, such as {{m|ja|太郎}}{{m|ja|君|tr=Tarō-kun}}. Contrast with addressing one’s own older brother, when one uses the honorific {{m|ja|お兄さん|tr=onīsan}}.
